url.description: A url pointing to an fs resource, as per the PyFilesystem fsurl specification

preferred_dir.description: Directory to be first opened (e.g., myDir/mySubdir)

auth.description: Given any template {{VARS}} in the url, 'ask' (default) to open a dialog box asking for credentials, or `env` to pick up credentials from the server's environment variables

defaultWritable.description: Fallback for determining if resource is writeable. Used only if the underlying PyFilesystem does not provide this information (eg S3)

snippet.description: Per entry snippets for how to use it, e.g. a snippet for how to open a file from a given resource

label.description: The designator to show to users

caption.description: An optional, longer description to show to users

pattern.description: A regular expression to match against the full URL of the entry, indicating if this snippet is valid for it

template.description: A template string to build up the snippet

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: The list of fs resource specifications

default.label: Read CSV as dataframe
default.caption: Read the contents of this CSV file as a pandas DataFrame
default.template:
# uses https://docs.pyfilesystem.org/en/latest/reference/base.html#fs.base.FS.openbin 
from jupyterfs import open_fs
import pandas
with open_fs("{{url}}") as fs_instance:
    df = pandas.read_csv(fs_instance.openbin("{{path}}"))

default.label: Read contents
default.caption: Read the contents of this file with PyFilesystem
default.template:
# uses https://docs.pyfilesystem.org/en/latest/reference/base.html#fs.base.FS.readbytes 
from jupyterfs import open_fs
with open_fs("{{url}}") as fs_instance:
    contents = fs_instance.readbytes("{{path}}")

default.label: List directory contents
default.caption: List the entries of this directory with PyFilesystem
default.template:
# uses https://docs.pyfilesystem.org/en/latest/reference/base.html#fs.base.FS.listdir 
from jupyterfs import open_fs
with open_fs("{{url}}") as fs_instance:

default.label: Read Excel as dataframe
default.caption: Read the contents of this Excel file as a pandas DataFrame
default.template:
# uses https://docs.pyfilesystem.org/en/latest/reference/base.html#fs.base.FS.open 
from jupyterfs import open_fs
import pandas
with open_fs("{{url}}") as fs_instance:
    df = pandas.read_excel(fs_instance.open("{{path}}", mode="rb"))

default.label: Write dataframe as CSV
default.caption: Save a pandas DF from the session to the given CSV file with PyFilesystem
default.template:
# uses https://docs.pyfilesystem.org/en/latest/reference/base.html#fs.base.FS.writetext 
from jupyterfs import open_fs
with open_fs("{{url}}") as fs_instance:
    fs_instance.writetext("{{path}}", YOUR_DF_VARIABLE.to_csv())

default.label: Write contents

with open_fs("{{url}}") as fs_instance:

cache.description: If true, only recreate the actual resources when necessary (ie on initial load or changes to 'resources')

verbose.description: If true, jupyter-fs will output helpful info messages to the console

writtenVersion.description: The version of the schema these settings were written with (do not edit)

display_columns.title: Display Columns
display_columns.description: The list of columns that will be displayed
